issue.title: Vanilla flavor: Long lines overflowing in preformatted text (code blocks)
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

Post something like:
```
`​``
long line long line long line long line long line long line long line long line long line
`​``
```

(there's zero-width spaces so the code block on Github doesn't break)

### Expected behaviour

The line should break, and not overflow

### Actual behaviour

The line overflows when viewing using the vanilla flavor

### Detailed description

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6217438/199586742-7721a5b0-16c3-4593-8131-71c9b77831d8.png)


### Specifications

[Catstodon](https://github.com/kescherCode/catstodon) v3.5.3+cat+1.1.1
Firefox 106.0.1 (Fedora 36)

comment.body: Just tested to also occur in pure glitch-soc, so not caused by the Catstodon fork.

issue.title: Some server-side settings have been lost in upstream merge
issue.body:
Some server-side settings have been lost in an upstream merge:
- `hide_followers_count`
- `show_reblogs_in_public_timelines`
- `show_replies_in_public_timelines`
- `outgoing_spoilers`

It's unclear where we should put them in the new server settings page.

comment.body: imo, it should be put into `/admin/settings/discovery`, as that's approximately where it had previously been.

issue.title: Public profile page is not rendered while AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode is on
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Upgrade to v4.0.0rc1
2. enable AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode
3. Go to some user page (eg: domain.tld/@admin)
4. The API request is failing with 401 unauthorized
...


### Expected behaviour

Render Public profile without problem

### Actual behaviour

401 error occured

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Specifications

Mastodon v4.0.0rc1 with AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode on

comment.body: It may also be worth noting that some forks of Pleroma/Akkoma have a way to only show local users on timelines as well on AUTHORIZED_FETCH enabled instances, even going as far as to make any remote users unlinkable, too.

issue.title: Public profile page is not rendered while AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode is on
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Upgrade to v4.0.0rc1
2. enable AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode
3. Go to some user page (eg: domain.tld/@admin)
4. The API request is failing with 401 unauthorized
...


### Expected behaviour

Render Public profile without problem

### Actual behaviour

401 error occured

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Specifications

Mastodon v4.0.0rc1 with AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode on

comment.body:
In my opinion, this is too much of a difference between the now removed haml-based Web UI and the React-based one.

It does somewhat make sense for AUTHORIZED_FETCH to behave this way, but there should be an additional setting for instance owners that want to use AUTHORIZED_FETCH to have only public posts (not even unlisted ones) displayed in timelines, ideally only of local users, and that want public and unlisted posts of only local users to remain publicly linkable. This would be an improvement in compliance with AUTHORIZED_FETCH, while still allowing proper outside linking.

issue.title: Expose glitch-soc base in API
issue.body:
### Pitch

Expose the fact that an instance is either running glitch-soc or is based on it in the API somewhere (maybe in `/api/v{1,2}/instance`?)

### Motivation

While glitch-soc itself does expose this fact in the version string using the suffix `+glitch`, once an instance changes this prefix (as forks like [types.pl](https://github.com/ralsei/types.pl/blob/types.pl/lib/mastodon/version.rb) have done), clients can't really detect the difference between vanilla and glitch-soc effectively.

comment.body: Well, this fork has specific features not available to vanilla Mastodon. Namely local-only posts and post type (plain, Markdown, HTML). There currently isn't a good way to detect the support of these features, as far as I'm aware. (If there is, do tell me.)

issue.title: Expose glitch-soc base in API
issue.body:
### Pitch

Expose the fact that an instance is either running glitch-soc or is based on it in the API somewhere (maybe in `/api/v{1,2}/instance`?)

### Motivation

While glitch-soc itself does expose this fact in the version string using the suffix `+glitch`, once an instance changes this prefix (as forks like [types.pl](https://github.com/ralsei/types.pl/blob/types.pl/lib/mastodon/version.rb) have done), clients can't really detect the difference between vanilla and glitch-soc effectively.

issue.title: Render Misskey quote renotes better
issue.body:
### Pitch

I've searched existing issues because I was kind of surprised it didn't exist already, but how hard would it be to properly render Misskey quote renotes?  Ideally this would include presenting the full quote text in the web UI, making it clickable to open the original thread without jumping into a new tab and going to the original instance, and finding some way to present that to "normal" client apps.  Notifying the author of the original post if local to the instance would also be desirable.

### Motivation

Quote renotes are just plain annoying to use right now - in Tusky at least the link click stays in-app, though it still makes it hard to follow threads with repeated re-notes, and there's always a one-way relationship - you cannot jump from a post to its quote renotes.  I'm not sure how massive the required changes on the server side would be, but as it's at least presented as structured data via federation, the server is in a better position to do it than the client, and it could in the worst case just store it as another reply.  Also, this would enable the server to send a mention to the quoted user if local, avoiding another big usability issue with quote renotes.  As such a feature would almost certainly be rejected by mainline Mastodon due to the projects opinions on quote posts, adding at least visibility (if not the ability to write such posts, I'm still a bit split on whether that's actually desirable myself) seems like the least bad solution here.

comment.body: Akkoma has these now as well.

issue.title: Some activities from mastodon.social are missing an object_uri?
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Check "Dead" tab on Sidekiq
2. See dead entries with error "NoMethodError: undefined method `start_with?' for nil:NilClass"
...


### Expected behaviour

These entries should not exist

### Actual behaviour

They do exist, indicating a failure either on the sending side or the receiving side

### Detailed description

I only see them on activities from mastodon.social.

ActivityPub::ProcessingWorker – NoMethodError: undefined method `start_with?' for nil:NilClass

```
Arguments: 108148003666047435, "{\"@context\":[\"https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams\",{\"Hashtag\":\"as:Hashtag\"}],\"type\":\"Add\",\"actor\":\"https://mastodon.social/users/Gargron\",\"target\":\"https://mastodon.social/users/Gargron/collections/featured\",\"object\":{\"type\":\"Hashtag\",\"href\":\"https://mastodon.social/@Gargron/tagged/mastodev\",\"name\":\"#mastodev\"},\"signature\":{\"type\":\"RsaSignature2017\",\"creator\":\"https://mastodon.social/users/Gargron#main-key\",\"created\":\"2022-10-24T09:50:09Z\",\"signatureValue\":\"\"}}", nil, "Account"
```

Error backtrace:
```
/opt/mastodon/live/app/lib/activitypub/activity.rb:153:in `fetch_remote_original_status'
/opt/mastodon/live/app/lib/activitypub/activity.rb:113:in `status_from_object'
/opt/mastodon/live/app/lib/activitypub/activity/add.rb:7:in `perform'
```
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/blob/5fa340931e2bd39a4bcccc9a97ad58e13a2d56ab/app/lib/activitypub/activity.rb#L152-L159

### Specifications

3.5.3, latest

issue.title: Sidekiq crashes with jemalloc in blurhash gem when processing media attachments
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Run a Mastodon instance as described in "Installing from source"
2. Monitor `journalctl -u mastodon-sidekiq -f` for segmentation faults
3. `/opt/mastodon/live/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.0.0/gems/blurhash-0.1.6/lib/blurhash.rb:10: [BUG] Segmentation fault at 0x00007f565be8e000`, followed by lots of call stack information and a sidekiq crash.

### Expected behaviour

No segmentation faults

### Actual behaviour

Segmentation fault in the blurhash gem, specifically when the FFI function blurHashForPixels is called.

### Specifications

I have been investigating this bug for a while now, so this has been occuring at least since 3.5.2, and occurs up until the latest commit (3e0999cd1139d638332d62129dbf0b37263802fd)

This bug is remedied by not compiling Ruby with jemalloc and also not preloading jemalloc for mastodon-sidekiq. Doing either will eventually cause this segmentation fault a few times during a day. However, this remedy is not desirable due to what's mentioned in #7257 (in fact, my sidekiq has swollen up to 2.5 GiB RSS, but that doesn't matter for now).

This segmentation fault occurs consistently **only** in the `blurhash` gem, but I am not sure the gem itself is faulty, but rather, it may be some sort of weird interaction with Ruby when jemalloc is loaded. That's why I am reporting it here, not at the `blurhash` gem itself.

The crash memory address in step 3 is interesting. It always differs, but it is either at the border between a rw memory region and a non-rw memory region (In this case, look where `7f565be8e000` is):

```
7f565be27000-7f565be40000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be40000-7f565be45000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be45000-7f565be64000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be64000-7f565be8e000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be8e000-7f565be92000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be92000-7f565be93000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be93000-7f565be9d000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be9d000-7f565bea0000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565bea0000-7f565bea8000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
```

or it is sometimes outside the memory allocated to the process entirely.

Here's a dump by https://is-a.cat/@ar: https://gist.github.com/7b0585cc1ef9de33efce07f9ab9ed0bc

comment.body:
Update: This exact same bug happens with mastodon-web too now. Exact same crash at :blurHashForPixels in the blurhash gem.

I still blame jemalloc. This does *not* happen with other allocators, such as mimalloc (which does consume more memory than jemalloc, however). I can safely rule out a bug in the blurhash gem and I blame jemalloc.

issue.title: Direct messages
issue.body:
### Pitch

I noticed that direct messages shows on feed also instead of showing when you click to your inbox. This is very inconvenient and can be confusing. it should be fixed. Thank you for the work you are doing

### Motivation

At first i was thinking my direct message was been seen by everyone, it will be great to keep the DM in the inbox so users won't be confused.

comment.body:
In the glitch-soc Web UI fork, this is solved by highlighting the DM status background on feeds, in replies, etc. in a different color. Not to mention the much more visible status icons, because they're filled icons and also colorized.

![Normal posts using the default mastodon gray background, while a direct message is highlighted in a lighter gray](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/194754012-13fbe383-a246-47d4-b4fd-a80358da6d2b.png)

issue.title: [BUG]: Feeds in Nextcloud News will not show any items without a title tag (but with link and description tag)
issue.body:
### Brief description of the issue

When having a feed like https://toot.site/tags/Cats.rss in Nextcloud News, you will see no articles in RSS Guard. In Nextcloud News, as well as in its companion Android app, this works fine.

This feed's articles have no `<title>` tag, but they do have a `<description>` tag. Only one of the two is required for an article according to RSS 2.0 spec.

### How to reproduce the bug?

1. Add feed to Nextcloud News
2. Synchronize folders and other items

### What was the expected result?

The feed should show articles, either with an empty title or falling back to some other default, as is done with the **RSS/ATOM/JSON** pseudo-account when feeds are in RSS Guard itself: 
![The RSS feed showing a list of articles, with the `<link>` tag being used as fallback.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/193987710-26e09ce7-0bdd-4eb4-92ee-822fc694e6b8.png)



### What actually happened?

The feed articles don't show up at all.
![Empty RSS feed list](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/193987855-4e8240e3-826b-4f04-af10-c45aca90427f.png)
![the same RSS feed not being empty when Nextcloud News renders it](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/193987996-a3813fae-fe02-4392-ae73-b917449be7ec.png)

### Debug log

N/A

### Operating system and version

* OS: Arch Linux
* RSS Guard version: 4.2.5, but the issue reaches back a while

issue.title: Add back titles to RSS feeds
issue.body:
Originally, RSS feed titles were removed in #18640, as they were simply the created date, which wasn't useful.
However, since empty title fields in RSS readers are even less useful (and some readers ignore any such posts entirely), I am making this PR.

Changes:

- Account RSS feed title now says "New post", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.
- Tag RSS feed will say "New post by \<user handle>", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.

pull_request.title: Add back titles to RSS feeds
pull_request.body:
Originally, RSS feed titles were removed in #18640, as they were simply the created date, which wasn't useful.
However, since empty title fields in RSS readers are even less useful (and some readers ignore any such posts entirely), I am making this PR.

Changes:

- Account RSS feed title now says "New post", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.
- Tag RSS feed will say "New post by <user handle>", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.

issue.title: Vanilla flavor: Long lines overflowing in preformatted text (code blocks)
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

Post something like:
```
`​``
long line long line long line long line long line long line long line long line long line
`​``
```

(there's zero-width spaces so the code block on Github doesn't break)

### Expected behaviour

The line should break, and not overflow

### Actual behaviour

The line overflows when viewing using the vanilla flavor

### Detailed description

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6217438/199586742-7721a5b0-16c3-4593-8131-71c9b77831d8.png)


### Specifications

[Catstodon](https://github.com/kescherCode/catstodon) v3.5.3+cat+1.1.1
Firefox 106.0.1 (Fedora 36)

comment.body: Just tested to also occur in pure glitch-soc, so not caused by the Catstodon fork.

It's unclear where we should put them in the new server settings page.

issue.title: Public profile page is not rendered while AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode is on
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Upgrade to v4.0.0rc1
2. enable AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode
3. Go to some user page (eg: domain.tld/@admin)
4. The API request is failing with 401 unauthorized
...


### Expected behaviour

Render Public profile without problem

### Actual behaviour

401 error occured

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Specifications

Mastodon v4.0.0rc1 with AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode on

comment.body: It may also be worth noting that some forks of Pleroma/Akkoma have a way to only show local users on timelines as well on AUTHORIZED_FETCH enabled instances, even going as far as to make any remote users unlinkable, too.

issue.title: Public profile page is not rendered while AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode is on
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Upgrade to v4.0.0rc1
2. enable AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode
3. Go to some user page (eg: domain.tld/@admin)
4. The API request is failing with 401 unauthorized
...


### Expected behaviour

Render Public profile without problem

### Actual behaviour

401 error occured

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Specifications

Mastodon v4.0.0rc1 with AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode on

comment.body:
In my opinion, this is too much of a difference between the now removed haml-based Web UI and the React-based one.

It does somewhat make sense for AUTHORIZED_FETCH to behave this way, but there should be an additional setting for instance owners that want to use AUTHORIZED_FETCH to have only public posts (not even unlisted ones) displayed in timelines, ideally only of local users, and that want public and unlisted posts of only local users to remain publicly linkable. This would be an improvement in compliance with AUTHORIZED_FETCH, while still allowing proper outside linking.

issue.title: Expose glitch-soc base in API
issue.body:
### Pitch

Expose the fact that an instance is either running glitch-soc or is based on it in the API somewhere (maybe in `/api/v{1,2}/instance`?)

### Motivation

While glitch-soc itself does expose this fact in the version string using the suffix `+glitch`, once an instance changes this prefix (as forks like [types.pl](https://github.com/ralsei/types.pl/blob/types.pl/lib/mastodon/version.rb) have done), clients can't really detect the difference between vanilla and glitch-soc effectively.

comment.body: Well, this fork has specific features not available to vanilla Mastodon. Namely local-only posts and post type (plain, Markdown, HTML). There currently isn't a good way to detect the support of these features, as far as I'm aware. (If there is, do tell me.)

issue.title: Expose glitch-soc base in API
issue.body:
### Pitch

Expose the fact that an instance is either running glitch-soc or is based on it in the API somewhere (maybe in `/api/v{1,2}/instance`?)

### Motivation

While glitch-soc itself does expose this fact in the version string using the suffix `+glitch`, once an instance changes this prefix (as forks like [types.pl](https://github.com/ralsei/types.pl/blob/types.pl/lib/mastodon/version.rb) have done), clients can't really detect the difference between vanilla and glitch-soc effectively.

issue.title: Render Misskey quote renotes better
issue.body:
### Pitch

I've searched existing issues because I was kind of surprised it didn't exist already, but how hard would it be to properly render Misskey quote renotes?  Ideally this would include presenting the full quote text in the web UI, making it clickable to open the original thread without jumping into a new tab and going to the original instance, and finding some way to present that to "normal" client apps.  Notifying the author of the original post if local to the instance would also be desirable.

### Motivation

Quote renotes are just plain annoying to use right now - in Tusky at least the link click stays in-app, though it still makes it hard to follow threads with repeated re-notes, and there's always a one-way relationship - you cannot jump from a post to its quote renotes.  I'm not sure how massive the required changes on the server side would be, but as it's at least presented as structured data via federation, the server is in a better position to do it than the client, and it could in the worst case just store it as another reply.  Also, this would enable the server to send a mention to the quoted user if local, avoiding another big usability issue with quote renotes.  As such a feature would almost certainly be rejected by mainline Mastodon due to the projects opinions on quote posts, adding at least visibility (if not the ability to write such posts, I'm still a bit split on whether that's actually desirable myself) seems like the least bad solution here.

issue.title: Vanilla flavor displays NaN in place of remaining character count
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Switch to vanilla flavour
2. Compose a post

### Expected behaviour

Character counter should show remaining characters

### Actual behaviour

NaN

### Detailed description

![The Mastodon web compose box, vanilla flavour, showing "NaN" in place of where the character count is supposed to be](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/199205356-415e8542-5a0a-45fc-a412-bc2395364c68.png)

It stays this way even when typing in something.

pull_request.title: Redirect old /web links
pull_request.body: Some folks used to copy post links from the address bar. All such links break when the path starts with `/web`.

commits.message: Fix logged-out web UI on smaller screens (#19263)
Remove code for rendering public and hashtag timelines outside the web UI (#19257)

Fix deleted pinned posts potentially counting towards the pinned posts limit (#19005)

Fixes #18938
Add server banner to web app, add `GET /api/v2/instance` to REST API (#19294)

Change public timelines to be filtered by current locale by default (#19291)

In the absence of an opt-in to multiple specific languages in the
preferences, it makes more sense to filter by the user's presumed
language only (interface language or `lang` override)
Change font size of active users in server banner to be larger in web UI (#19295)

Bump jest-environment-jsdom from 29.0.3 to 29.1.2 (#19282)

- [Release notes](https://github.com/facebook/jest/releases)

issue.title: Some activities from mastodon.social are missing an object_uri?
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Check "Dead" tab on Sidekiq
2. See dead entries with error "NoMethodError: undefined method `start_with?' for nil:NilClass"
...


### Expected behaviour

These entries should not exist

### Actual behaviour

They do exist, indicating a failure either on the sending side or the receiving side

### Detailed description

I only see them on activities from mastodon.social.

ActivityPub::ProcessingWorker – NoMethodError: undefined method `start_with?' for nil:NilClass

```
Arguments: 108148003666047435, "{\"@context\":[\"https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams\",{\"Hashtag\":\"as:Hashtag\"}],\"type\":\"Add\",\"actor\":\"https://mastodon.social/users/Gargron\",\"target\":\"https://mastodon.social/users/Gargron/collections/featured\",\"object\":{\"type\":\"Hashtag\",\"href\":\"https://mastodon.social/@Gargron/tagged/mastodev\",\"name\":\"#mastodev\"},\"signature\":{\"type\":\"RsaSignature2017\",\"creator\":\"https://mastodon.social/users/Gargron#main-key\",\"created\":\"2022-10-24T09:50:09Z\",\"signatureValue\":\"\"}}", nil, "Account"
```

Error backtrace:
```
/opt/mastodon/live/app/lib/activitypub/activity.rb:153:in `fetch_remote_original_status'
/opt/mastodon/live/app/lib/activitypub/activity.rb:113:in `status_from_object'
/opt/mastodon/live/app/lib/activitypub/activity/add.rb:7:in `perform'
```
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/blob/5fa340931e2bd39a4bcccc9a97ad58e13a2d56ab/app/lib/activitypub/activity.rb#L152-L159

### Specifications

3.5.3, latest

issue.title: Sidekiq crashes with jemalloc in blurhash gem when processing media attachments
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Run a Mastodon instance as described in "Installing from source"
2. Monitor `journalctl -u mastodon-sidekiq -f` for segmentation faults
3. `/opt/mastodon/live/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.0.0/gems/blurhash-0.1.6/lib/blurhash.rb:10: [BUG] Segmentation fault at 0x00007f565be8e000`, followed by lots of call stack information and a sidekiq crash.

### Expected behaviour

No segmentation faults

### Actual behaviour

Segmentation fault in the blurhash gem, specifically when the FFI function blurHashForPixels is called.

### Specifications

I have been investigating this bug for a while now, so this has been occuring at least since 3.5.2, and occurs up until the latest commit (3e0999cd1139d638332d62129dbf0b37263802fd)

This bug is remedied by not compiling Ruby with jemalloc and also not preloading jemalloc for mastodon-sidekiq. Doing either will eventually cause this segmentation fault a few times during a day. However, this remedy is not desirable due to what's mentioned in #7257 (in fact, my sidekiq has swollen up to 2.5 GiB RSS, but that doesn't matter for now).

This segmentation fault occurs consistently **only** in the `blurhash` gem, but I am not sure the gem itself is faulty, but rather, it may be some sort of weird interaction with Ruby when jemalloc is loaded. That's why I am reporting it here, not at the `blurhash` gem itself.

The crash memory address in step 3 is interesting. It always differs, but it is either at the border between a rw memory region and a non-rw memory region (In this case, look where `7f565be8e000` is):

```
7f565be27000-7f565be40000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be40000-7f565be45000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be45000-7f565be64000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be64000-7f565be8e000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be8e000-7f565be92000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be92000-7f565be93000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be93000-7f565be9d000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be9d000-7f565bea0000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565bea0000-7f565bea8000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
```

or it is sometimes outside the memory allocated to the process entirely.

Here's a dump by https://is-a.cat/@ar: https://gist.github.com/7b0585cc1ef9de33efce07f9ab9ed0bc

comment.body:
Update: This exact same bug happens with mastodon-web too now. Exact same crash at :blurHashForPixels in the blurhash gem.

I still blame jemalloc. This does *not* happen with other allocators, such as mimalloc (which does consume more memory than jemalloc, however). I can safely rule out a bug in the blurhash gem and I blame jemalloc.

issue.title: Direct messages
issue.body:
### Pitch

I noticed that direct messages shows on feed also instead of showing when you click to your inbox. This is very inconvenient and can be confusing. it should be fixed. Thank you for the work you are doing

### Motivation

At first i was thinking my direct message was been seen by everyone, it will be great to keep the DM in the inbox so users won't be confused.

comment.body:
In the glitch-soc Web UI fork, this is solved by highlighting the DM status background on feeds, in replies, etc. in a different color. Not to mention the much more visible status icons, because they're filled icons and also colorized.

![Normal posts using the default mastodon gray background, while a direct message is highlighted in a lighter gray](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/194754012-13fbe383-a246-47d4-b4fd-a80358da6d2b.png)

issue.title: [BUG]: Feeds in Nextcloud News will not show any items without a title tag (but with link and description tag)
issue.body:
### Brief description of the issue

When having a feed like https://toot.site/tags/Cats.rss in Nextcloud News, you will see no articles in RSS Guard. In Nextcloud News, as well as in its companion Android app, this works fine.

This feed's articles have no `<title>` tag, but they do have a `<description>` tag. Only one of the two is required for an article according to RSS 2.0 spec.

### How to reproduce the bug?

1. Add feed to Nextcloud News
2. Synchronize folders and other items

### What was the expected result?

The feed should show articles, either with an empty title or falling back to some other default, as is done with the **RSS/ATOM/JSON** pseudo-account when feeds are in RSS Guard itself: 
![The RSS feed showing a list of articles, with the `<link>` tag being used as fallback.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/193987710-26e09ce7-0bdd-4eb4-92ee-822fc694e6b8.png)



### What actually happened?

The feed articles don't show up at all.
![Empty RSS feed list](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/193987855-4e8240e3-826b-4f04-af10-c45aca90427f.png)
![the same RSS feed not being empty when Nextcloud News renders it](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/193987996-a3813fae-fe02-4392-ae73-b917449be7ec.png)

### Debug log

N/A

### Operating system and version

* OS: Arch Linux
* RSS Guard version: 4.2.5, but the issue reaches back a while

issue.title: Add back titles to RSS feeds
issue.body:
Originally, RSS feed titles were removed in #18640, as they were simply the created date, which wasn't useful.
However, since empty title fields in RSS readers are even less useful (and some readers ignore any such posts entirely), I am making this PR.

Changes:

- Account RSS feed title now says "New post", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.
- Tag RSS feed will say "New post by \<user handle>", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.

pull_request.title: Add back titles to RSS feeds
pull_request.body:
Originally, RSS feed titles were removed in #18640, as they were simply the created date, which wasn't useful.
However, since empty title fields in RSS readers are even less useful (and some readers ignore any such posts entirely), I am making this PR.

Changes:

- Account RSS feed title now says "New post", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.
- Tag RSS feed will say "New post by <user handle>", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.

issue.title: Public profile page is not rendered while AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode is on
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Upgrade to v4.0.0rc1
2. enable AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode
3. Go to some user page (eg: domain.tld/@admin)
4. The API request is failing with 401 unauthorized
...


### Expected behaviour

Render Public profile without problem

### Actual behaviour

401 error occured

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Specifications

Mastodon v4.0.0rc1 with AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode on

comment.body: It may also be worth noting that some forks of Pleroma/Akkoma have a way to only show local users on timelines as well on AUTHORIZED_FETCH enabled instances, even going as far as to make any remote users unlinkable, too.

issue.title: Public profile page is not rendered while AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode is on
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Upgrade to v4.0.0rc1
2. enable AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode
3. Go to some user page (eg: domain.tld/@admin)
4. The API request is failing with 401 unauthorized
...


### Expected behaviour

Render Public profile without problem

### Actual behaviour

401 error occured

### Detailed description

_No response_

### Specifications

Mastodon v4.0.0rc1 with AUTHORIZED_FETCH mode on

comment.body:
In my opinion, this is too much of a difference between the now removed haml-based Web UI and the React-based one.

It does somewhat make sense for AUTHORIZED_FETCH to behave this way, but there should be an additional setting for instance owners that want to use AUTHORIZED_FETCH to have only public posts (not even unlisted ones) displayed in timelines, ideally only of local users, and that want public and unlisted posts of only local users to remain publicly linkable. This would be an improvement in compliance with AUTHORIZED_FETCH, while still allowing proper outside linking.

issue.title: Expose glitch-soc base in API
issue.body:
### Pitch

Expose the fact that an instance is either running glitch-soc or is based on it in the API somewhere (maybe in `/api/v{1,2}/instance`?)

### Motivation

While glitch-soc itself does expose this fact in the version string using the suffix `+glitch`, once an instance changes this prefix (as forks like [types.pl](https://github.com/ralsei/types.pl/blob/types.pl/lib/mastodon/version.rb) have done), clients can't really detect the difference between vanilla and glitch-soc effectively.

comment.body: Well, this fork has specific features not available to vanilla Mastodon. Namely local-only posts and post type (plain, Markdown, HTML). There currently isn't a good way to detect the support of these features, as far as I'm aware. (If there is, do tell me.)

issue.title: Expose glitch-soc base in API
issue.body:
### Pitch

Expose the fact that an instance is either running glitch-soc or is based on it in the API somewhere (maybe in `/api/v{1,2}/instance`?)

### Motivation

While glitch-soc itself does expose this fact in the version string using the suffix `+glitch`, once an instance changes this prefix (as forks like [types.pl](https://github.com/ralsei/types.pl/blob/types.pl/lib/mastodon/version.rb) have done), clients can't really detect the difference between vanilla and glitch-soc effectively.

issue.title: Render Misskey quote renotes better
issue.body:
### Pitch

I've searched existing issues because I was kind of surprised it didn't exist already, but how hard would it be to properly render Misskey quote renotes?  Ideally this would include presenting the full quote text in the web UI, making it clickable to open the original thread without jumping into a new tab and going to the original instance, and finding some way to present that to "normal" client apps.  Notifying the author of the original post if local to the instance would also be desirable.

### Motivation

Quote renotes are just plain annoying to use right now - in Tusky at least the link click stays in-app, though it still makes it hard to follow threads with repeated re-notes, and there's always a one-way relationship - you cannot jump from a post to its quote renotes.  I'm not sure how massive the required changes on the server side would be, but as it's at least presented as structured data via federation, the server is in a better position to do it than the client, and it could in the worst case just store it as another reply.  Also, this would enable the server to send a mention to the quoted user if local, avoiding another big usability issue with quote renotes.  As such a feature would almost certainly be rejected by mainline Mastodon due to the projects opinions on quote posts, adding at least visibility (if not the ability to write such posts, I'm still a bit split on whether that's actually desirable myself) seems like the least bad solution here.

comment.body: Akkoma has these now as well.

commits.message: Fix logged-out web UI on smaller screens (#19263)
Remove code for rendering public and hashtag timelines outside the web UI (#19257)

Fix deleted pinned posts potentially counting towards the pinned posts limit (#19005)

Fixes #18938
Add server banner to web app, add `GET /api/v2/instance` to REST API (#19294)

Change public timelines to be filtered by current locale by default (#19291)

In the absence of an opt-in to multiple specific languages in the
preferences, it makes more sense to filter by the user's presumed
language only (interface language or `lang` override)
Change font size of active users in server banner to be larger in web UI (#19295)

preferences, it makes more sense to filter by the user's presumed
language only (interface language or `lang` override)

issue.title: Some activities from mastodon.social are missing an object_uri?
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Check "Dead" tab on Sidekiq
2. See dead entries with error "NoMethodError: undefined method `start_with?' for nil:NilClass"
...


### Expected behaviour

These entries should not exist

### Actual behaviour

They do exist, indicating a failure either on the sending side or the receiving side

### Detailed description

I only see them on activities from mastodon.social.

ActivityPub::ProcessingWorker – NoMethodError: undefined method `start_with?' for nil:NilClass

```
Arguments: 108148003666047435, "{\"@context\":[\"https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams\",{\"Hashtag\":\"as:Hashtag\"}],\"type\":\"Add\",\"actor\":\"https://mastodon.social/users/Gargron\",\"target\":\"https://mastodon.social/users/Gargron/collections/featured\",\"object\":{\"type\":\"Hashtag\",\"href\":\"https://mastodon.social/@Gargron/tagged/mastodev\",\"name\":\"#mastodev\"},\"signature\":{\"type\":\"RsaSignature2017\",\"creator\":\"https://mastodon.social/users/Gargron#main-key\",\"created\":\"2022-10-24T09:50:09Z\",\"signatureValue\":\"\"}}", nil, "Account"
```

Error backtrace:
```
/opt/mastodon/live/app/lib/activitypub/activity.rb:153:in `fetch_remote_original_status'
/opt/mastodon/live/app/lib/activitypub/activity.rb:113:in `status_from_object'
/opt/mastodon/live/app/lib/activitypub/activity/add.rb:7:in `perform'
```
https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/blob/5fa340931e2bd39a4bcccc9a97ad58e13a2d56ab/app/lib/activitypub/activity.rb#L152-L159

### Specifications

3.5.3, latest

issue.title: Sidekiq crashes with jemalloc in blurhash gem when processing media attachments
issue.body:
### Steps to reproduce the problem

1. Run a Mastodon instance as described in "Installing from source"
2. Monitor `journalctl -u mastodon-sidekiq -f` for segmentation faults
3. `/opt/mastodon/live/vendor/bundle/ruby/3.0.0/gems/blurhash-0.1.6/lib/blurhash.rb:10: [BUG] Segmentation fault at 0x00007f565be8e000`, followed by lots of call stack information and a sidekiq crash.

### Expected behaviour

No segmentation faults

### Actual behaviour

Segmentation fault in the blurhash gem, specifically when the FFI function blurHashForPixels is called.

### Specifications

I have been investigating this bug for a while now, so this has been occuring at least since 3.5.2, and occurs up until the latest commit (3e0999cd1139d638332d62129dbf0b37263802fd)

This bug is remedied by not compiling Ruby with jemalloc and also not preloading jemalloc for mastodon-sidekiq. Doing either will eventually cause this segmentation fault a few times during a day. However, this remedy is not desirable due to what's mentioned in #7257 (in fact, my sidekiq has swollen up to 2.5 GiB RSS, but that doesn't matter for now).

This segmentation fault occurs consistently **only** in the `blurhash` gem, but I am not sure the gem itself is faulty, but rather, it may be some sort of weird interaction with Ruby when jemalloc is loaded. That's why I am reporting it here, not at the `blurhash` gem itself.

The crash memory address in step 3 is interesting. It always differs, but it is either at the border between a rw memory region and a non-rw memory region (In this case, look where `7f565be8e000` is):

```
7f565be27000-7f565be40000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be40000-7f565be45000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be45000-7f565be64000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be64000-7f565be8e000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be8e000-7f565be92000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be92000-7f565be93000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be93000-7f565be9d000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565be9d000-7f565bea0000 rw-p 00000000 00:00 0
7f565bea0000-7f565bea8000 ---p 00000000 00:00 0
```

or it is sometimes outside the memory allocated to the process entirely.

Here's a dump by https://is-a.cat/@ar: https://gist.github.com/7b0585cc1ef9de33efce07f9ab9ed0bc

comment.body:
Update: This exact same bug happens with mastodon-web too now. Exact same crash at :blurHashForPixels in the blurhash gem.

I still blame jemalloc. This does *not* happen with other allocators, such as mimalloc (which does consume more memory than jemalloc, however). I can safely rule out a bug in the blurhash gem and I blame jemalloc.

issue.title: Direct messages
issue.body:
### Pitch

I noticed that direct messages shows on feed also instead of showing when you click to your inbox. This is very inconvenient and can be confusing. it should be fixed. Thank you for the work you are doing

### Motivation

At first i was thinking my direct message was been seen by everyone, it will be great to keep the DM in the inbox so users won't be confused.

comment.body:
In the glitch-soc Web UI fork, this is solved by highlighting the DM status background on feeds, in replies, etc. in a different color. Not to mention the much more visible status icons, because they're filled icons and also colorized.

![Normal posts using the default mastodon gray background, while a direct message is highlighted in a lighter gray](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/194754012-13fbe383-a246-47d4-b4fd-a80358da6d2b.png)

issue.title: [BUG]: Feeds in Nextcloud News will not show any items without a title tag (but with link and description tag)
issue.body:
### Brief description of the issue

When having a feed like https://toot.site/tags/Cats.rss in Nextcloud News, you will see no articles in RSS Guard. In Nextcloud News, as well as in its companion Android app, this works fine.

This feed's articles have no `<title>` tag, but they do have a `<description>` tag. Only one of the two is required for an article according to RSS 2.0 spec.

### How to reproduce the bug?

1. Add feed to Nextcloud News
2. Synchronize folders and other items

### What was the expected result?

The feed should show articles, either with an empty title or falling back to some other default, as is done with the **RSS/ATOM/JSON** pseudo-account when feeds are in RSS Guard itself: 
![The RSS feed showing a list of articles, with the `<link>` tag being used as fallback.](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/193987710-26e09ce7-0bdd-4eb4-92ee-822fc694e6b8.png)



### What actually happened?

The feed articles don't show up at all.
![Empty RSS feed list](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/193987855-4e8240e3-826b-4f04-af10-c45aca90427f.png)
![the same RSS feed not being empty when Nextcloud News renders it](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23276523/193987996-a3813fae-fe02-4392-ae73-b917449be7ec.png)

### Debug log

N/A

### Operating system and version

* OS: Arch Linux
* RSS Guard version: 4.2.5, but the issue reaches back a while

issue.title: Add back titles to RSS feeds
issue.body:
Originally, RSS feed titles were removed in #18640, as they were simply the created date, which wasn't useful.
However, since empty title fields in RSS readers are even less useful (and some readers ignore any such posts entirely), I am making this PR.

Changes:

- Account RSS feed title now says "New post", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.
- Tag RSS feed will say "New post by \<user handle>", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.

pull_request.title: Add back titles to RSS feeds
pull_request.body:
Originally, RSS feed titles were removed in #18640, as they were simply the created date, which wasn't useful.
However, since empty title fields in RSS readers are even less useful (and some readers ignore any such posts entirely), I am making this PR.

Changes:

- Account RSS feed title now says "New post", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.
- Tag RSS feed will say "New post by <user handle>", plus any content warning appended, should it exist.
